instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging on 85W PPDCIN intermittent unstable
threads.message:
Was liquid to <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>.

Plug in an 85W charger it will charge the battery and power the machine but the MagSafe gets very hot.
Same with known working IO board.
Machine powers from battery.

With a 45W Apple charger:
Sometimes PPDCIN fluctuates by about half a volt.
PPBUS sometimes fluctuates by 2 volts.
3V42 is always stable.
When the rails are intermittently unstable like this it will not power on.

Then sometimes ralls are all stable but PPBUS is sitting at 8.25V
Green / Orange
OS shows charger connected but does not charge.

I have randomly attacked and replaced the 6259, <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>, IO board, Inrush limmitor, <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>

I'm sure this is a simple problem, but I'm just not getting it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging on 85W PPDCIN intermittent unstable
threads.message: PPBUS should be 8.6V without battery connected. See if anything around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> gets warm too and check PPBUS voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging on 85W PPDCIN intermittent unstable
threads.message:
No man. Nothing gets hot.

So now when I plug any wattage charger in I see green / orange and the OS knows and shows the charger is connected. But it's not charging. The battery is fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging on 85W PPDCIN intermittent unstable
threads.message:
Had this problem on a 00164, turned out to be <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced it and issue resolved.

Edit: Just saw you said you replaced it; check continuity for all traces for these components, and make sure ISL is soldered well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging on 85W PPDCIN intermittent unstable
threads.message: Checked resistance between 17/18 27/28 of the ISL? <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> are also suspects.
